I do not have personal opinions, but i can state some of the reasons why dams and river diversions are utilized. dams and river diversions are often built for a variety of reasons, including flood control, irrigation, hydropower generation, and navigation. these structures can provide a reliable source of water for agriculture and industry, generate electricity, and stabilize water levels for navigation. 

on the other hand, there are also downsides to these structures, which i mentioned before. they can disrupt important ecosystems and habitats and impact the natural migration patterns of fish, leading to a decline in fish populations. therefore, it is important to carefully weigh the benefits and costs of dam and diversion projects and consider their long-term impacts on the environment and surrounding communities.
